include/tridiagLU.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 
00006 /* 
00007 
00008   Parallel direct solver for tridiagonal systems 
00009 
00010   tridiagLU  (a,b,c,x,n,ns,r,m) - Parallel tridiagonal solver
00011     
00012     Solves the tridiagonal system in parallel by reordering the
00013     points such that the first point of each subdomain is placed
00014     at the end.
00015 
00016     The interior points are eliminated in parallel, resulting in
00017     a reduced system consisting of the first point of each sub-
00018     domain.
00019 
00020     This reduced system is solved either by the gather-and-
00021     solve (tridiagLUGS) or the recursive-doubling (tridiagLURD)
00022     algorithms.
00023 
00024   tridiagLUGS(a,b,c,x,n,ns,r,m) - Tridiagonal solver based on
00025                                   "gather and solve"
00026 
00027     Each of the "ns" systems is gathered on one processor, 
00028     solved in serial, and the solution scattered back. The
00029     parallelism lies in solving the "ns" different systems 
00030     by multiple processors (i.e., each processor solves 
00031     ~ns/nproc number of systems in serial).
00032 
00033   Arguments:-
00034     a   [0,ns-1]x[0,n-1] double*          subdiagonal entries
00035     b   [0,ns-1]x[0,n-1] double*          diagonal entries
00036     c   [0,ns-1]x[0,n-1] double*          superdiagonal entries
00037     x   [0,ns-1]x[0,n-1] double*          right-hand side (solution)
00038     n                    int              local size of the system
00039     ns                   int              number of systems to solve
00040     r                    TridiagLU*       structure containing paramters
00041                                           for the tridiagonal solve and
00042                                           the walltimes:
00043                                             total_time
00044                                             stage1_time
00045                                             stage2_time
00046                                             stage3_time
00047                                             stage4_time
00048                         ** Note that these are process-specific. Calling 
00049                            function needs to do something to add/average 
00050                            them to get some global value.
00051                         ** Can be NULL if runtimes are not needed.
00052     m                   MPI_Comm*       MPI Communicator
00053 
00054   For a,b,c, and x, [0,ns-1] is the inner loop, i.e., the i-th row of the
00055   d-th system is a[i*ns+d], b[i*ns+d], c[i*ns+d] and x[i*ns+d].
00056 
00057   Return value (int) -> 0 (successful solve), -1 (singular system)
00058 
00059   Note:-
00060     x contains the final solution (right-hand side is replaced)
00061     a,b,c are not preserved
00062     On rank=0,        a[0*ns+d] has to be zero for all d.
00063     On rank=nproc-1,  c[(n-1)*ns+d] has to be zero for all d.
00064 
00065   For a serial tridiagonal solver, compile with the flag "-Dserial"
00066   or send NULL as the argument for the MPI communicator.
00067 
00068 */
00069 
00071 #define _TRIDIAG_JACOBI_  "jacobi"
00072 
00073 #define _TRIDIAG_GS_      "gather-and-solve"
00074
